p: Mean EORTC QLQ-H&N35 symptom scale scores are shown in Table 3. There were no significant QoL differences between the experimental and control groups except for swallowing ( P = .035), speech problems ( P = .034), and less sexuality ( P = .005). While almost all symptoms in experimental group were the highest immediate post radiotherapy but gradually decreased after radiotherapy, symptoms such as less sexuality, teeth, and opening mouth in control group were increased gradually after radiotherapy.
